content.question: Suppose an economy is operating above full employment. Which of the following fiscal policy actions and resulting changes in aggregate demand will move the economy back towards full employment?

choices.label: Increasing government spending, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve rightward.
Decreasing government spending, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve rightward.
Increasing taxes, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve leftward.
Decreasing taxes, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve leftward.
Increasing transfer payments, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve leftward.

content.answer: Increasing taxes, which will shift the <math alttext="A D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>AD</mtext></mrow></math> curve leftward.
